metadata.Description: Energy democracy is a concept that promotes the democratization of energy systems, giving communities and individuals more control over the production, distribution, and consumption of energy.

energy democracy.Description: Energy democracy addresses energy inequality by promoting equitable access to clean and affordable energy for all individuals and communities.
Energy democracy employs participatory decision-making processes to ensure that all stakeholders have a voice in shaping energy policies and projects.
Energy democracy collaborates with community-based organizations to empower local communities and facilitate their participation in the energy transition.
Energy democracy supports the establishment and growth of renewable energy cooperatives, enabling communities to collectively own and benefit from renewable energy projects.
Energy democracy administers feed-in tariff programs that incentivize the generation of renewable energy by allowing individuals and communities to sell excess electricity to the grid.
Energy democracy measures energy equity by assessing the fairness and accessibility of energy systems and ensuring that no one is left behind in the energy transition.
Energy democracy aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals, particularly Goal 7 on affordable and clean energy, to contribute to the achievement of sustainable development targets.
Energy democracy is an instance of the democratic energy transition, which aims to democratize energy systems and empower communities in shaping their energy future.
